required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: The PIONEER-IV Study is Comparing Clinical Outcomes Between Angiography-derived Physiology Guidance to Usual Care in an All-comers PCI Population With Unrestrictive Use of the HT Supreme Sirolimus-eluting Stent
clinical_study.official_title: Non-inferiority of Angiography-derived Physiology Guidance Versus Usual Care in an All-comers PCI Population Treated With Unrestricted Use of the Healing-Targeted Supreme (HT Supreme) Drug-eluting Stent and P2Y12 Inhibitor Monotherapy After 1-month of Dual-antiplatelet Therapy

lead_sponsor.agency: National University of Ireland, Galway, Ireland

clinical_study.source: National University of Ireland, Galway, Ireland

brief_summary.textblock: PIONEER-IV is a prospective, single-blind (patient), randomized, 1:1, controlled, multi-center study comparing clinical outcomes between angiography-derived physiology guidance to LRDP and usual care in an all-comers patient population (including patients with high bleeding risk, HBR) undergoing PCI with unrestrictive use of the HT Supreme sirolimus-eluting stent. Patients will be randomized to either angio-based physiology guidance (QFR) or local routine diagnostic procedure (LRDP) and usual care. Patients will be treated with 1-year P2Y12 inhibitor monotherapy after 1-month of dual-antiplatelet therapy in approximately 2540 (2*1270) patients. All patients (both cohorts) must receive dual anti-platelet therapy, being aspirin (ASA) and ticagrelor for 1 month, followed by 11 months of ticagrelor only (i.e. monotherapy). At 1 year, ticagrelor monotherapy is replaced by aspirin monotherapy or left to the discretion of the operator.

secondary_outcome.description: VoCE is a composite clinical endpoint of: Vessel-related cardiovascular Death Target-vessel related MI Clinically and physiologically-oriented Target vessel revascularization
DoCE is a composite endpoint of: Cardiovascular Death Target-vessel related MI Clinically and physiologically-oriented Target lesion revascularization
Peri-procedure Myocardial Infarction according to 4th universal definition
according to the statement from European Association of Percutaneous Cardiovascular Interventions (EAPCI) of the European Society of Cardiology (ESC)
TVF is a composite of: Cardiovascular Death Target-vessel related MI Clinically and physiologically-oriented Target vessel revascularization
Bleeding according to Bleeding Academic Research Consortium (BARC) (BARC 2, 3 and 5) classification

arm_group.arm_group_label: Angiography-derived Physiology Guidance (Quantitative Flow Ratio, QFR)
Local routine diagnostic procedure (LRDP) and usual care

intervention.intervention_name: Angiography-derived physiology guidance/Local routine diagnostic procedure (LRDP) and usual care
intervention.arm_group_label: Angiography-derived Physiology Guidance (Quantitative Flow Ratio, QFR)
Local routine diagnostic procedure (LRDP) and usual care

responsible_party.investigator_affiliation: National University of Ireland, Galway, Ireland
responsible_party.investigator_title: Professor of Interventional Cardiology & Innovation at the National University of Ireland, Galway, Ireland
